intro: Thlaspi sintenisii, commonly known as the alpine cabbages, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Alps and other mountainous areas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, helping it retain moisture in arid conditions. Thlaspi sintenisii is often found in alpine meadows and is a common species in subalpine and nival zones.
